# The `Type` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

The instances of the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> class are immutable: once they are created, they are never changed. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Declaration

<CodeBlock>class llvm::Type</CodeBlock>

## Description {#details}

The instances of the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> class are immutable: once they are created, they are never changed.

Also note that only one instance of a particular type is ever created. Thus seeing if two types are equal is a matter of doing a trivial pointer comparison. To enforce that no two equal instances are created, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> instances can only be created via static factory methods in class <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> and in derived classes. Once allocated, Types are never free&#39;d.

Definition at line 45 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/type-h">Type.h</a>.

Note: If you add an element to this, you need to add an element to the <a href="#a8afb3494f6f22e80508f1945a2466052">Type::getPrimitiveType</a> function, or else things will break! Also update <a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmccoretypes/#ga2da643b0ebe215106a07c8e03f3ad8d8">LLVMTypeKind</a> and LLVMGetTypeKind () in the C binding.

### getPrimitiveSizeInBits() {#a833daf718a49c5cd637d8c9ddeaebe07}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="TypeSize Type::getPrimitiveSizeInBits () const">
Return the basic size of this type if it is a primitive type.

These are fixed by LLVM and are not target-dependent. This will return zero if the type does not have a size or is not a primitive type.

If this is a scalable vector type, the scalable property will be set and the runtime size will be a positive integer multiple of the base size.

Note that this may not reflect the size of memory allocated for an instance of the type or the number of bytes that are written when an instance of the type is stored to memory. The <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/datalayout">DataLayout</a> class provides additional query functions to provide this information.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/type-h/#l00337">337</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/type-h">Type.h</a>, definition at line 202 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/sandboxir/type-cpp">Type.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### print() {#a91bbc1ac424839ba7e85d2d8542c288a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void Type::print (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-ostream">raw&#95;ostream</a> &amp; O, bool IsForDebug=false, bool NoDetails=false) const</>}>
Print the current type.

Omit the type details if <code>NoDetails</code> == true. E.g., let st = type &#123; i32, i16 &#125; When <code>NoDetails</code> is true, we only print st. Put differently, <code>NoDetails</code> prints the type as if inlined with the operands when printing an instruction.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/type-h/#l00122">122</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/type-h">Type.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/asmwriter-cpp/#l04969">4969</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/asmwriter-cpp">AsmWriter.cpp</a>.

### ContainedTys {#a96d2037eb473457f3222e5cbe7ea22b5}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Type&#42; const&#42; llvm::Type::ContainedTys = nullptr</>}
  labels = {["protected"]}>
A pointer to the array of Types contained by this <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a>.

For example, this includes the arguments of a function type, the elements of a structure, the pointee of a pointer, the element type of an array, etc. This pointer may be 0 for types that don&#39;t contain other types (Integer, Double, Float).

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/type-h/#l00113">113</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/type-h">Type.h</a>.
